text: hi everyone welcome back to my cupcake
addiction today I'm super excited to be
showing you how to make this gorgeous
rainbow layer My Little Pony cake it's
rainbow in the inside it's rainbow on
the outside and it's my little pony all
over I had a ton of requests for
something My Little Pony if you guys
think I've done a good job on this My
Little Pony cake I would love it if
you'd give it a share give it a like and
let me know what you think in the
comments below let's get started the
things that you need for today's
tutorial I've got an offset spatula I've
got a serrated knife or a bread knife
I've got an assortment of food colorings
and I've got red yellow green orange
blue and purple I've got a batch about
buttercream frosting which I've divided
into six bowls I will link to that
recipe in the description box below a
pastry brush this is a bit of a simple
sugar syrup so I just use like two
tablespoons of apricot jam with three
tablespoons of water and just microwave
it I've got my two little My Little Pony
figurines so I went with Rainbow Dash
and rarity but of course you can use
your favorite My Little Pony characters
I've got a little printable rainbow
template I'll leave a link to that one
in the description box below and this
one's perfect for a six inch cake I've
also got my baked Rainbow two layers of
cake so I'll be showing you how to bake
these but you'll need a double batch of
either a packet cake mix or enough of
your favorite vanilla or white cake mix
to make the equivalent of two six inch
round cakes I've also got a six inch
cake tin and some baking paper or grease
proof paper I've got two bamboo skewers
some sticky tape some spoons I'm using a
loyal number 15 open round pastry tip or
piping tip and a disposable piping bag
I've got a ten inch wooden cake board
which I'm just resting on a cake
decorating turntable for ease of today's
tutorial I've got some Jaffer's you can
also use whoppers Maltesers just any
kind of a round candy some cornflour
some white fondant and a fondant rolling
pin first of all you want to make up
your vanilla mix so I'm just gonna use a
packet mix today but you can use your
favourite vanilla cake mix or you can
use the vanilla cake mix out of my
cupcake addiction recipe ebook which I
will link to in the description box
below you want to mix that up and once
it's all mixed you want to divide your
butter evenly I'm just making five
layers today because I'm not gonna do a
blue layer of cake I'm gonna make some
red I'm just adding a generous amount of
color to each of my Bowl so I've got red
yellow green purple and orange
and I'm mixing that color all the way
through so I can't see any wife that are
particularly in the bottom corners of
the bowls you want to completely line
your cake tin with your grease proof or
baking paper and then we're just gonna
scoop in I'm gonna start with that
purple or whatever your base color is
going to be and use your spoon just to
level it out in the bottom of that
container I always put a circle of the
grease proof paper in the bottom and
then a collar of the grease proof paper
doubled over around the outside you want
to repeat this process for each of your
layers they're going to take about 15 to
20 minutes per layer they're only thin
but they are still six inches so you
want to make sure that they're cooked
all the way through and you'll know
they're done when they spring back in
the middle so you can see I'm really
just repeating the process with each of
our different colors until they're all
made let those completely cool and while
they're cooling we can color up our
buttercream frosting you do want a
generous amount of color in both the
batter's and the frostings because this
is a rainbow cake and you want those
colors to pop if you're using liquid
colors you'll always need a little bit
more of that than your color paste it's
cuz the color pastes are a bit more
concentrated so you don't need as much
mixing all of that color through once
again making sure that we're not getting
any white left in our buttercream
frosting and then you want to take your
cooled cooked layers and we're just
gonna carve the tops off them so you can
see they're all a bit brown on top but
once you carve away that kind of just
cooked edge you've got a really nice
bright vibrant color you want to repeat
that and you can actually use these
leftover offcuts for some of our rainbow
cake pops
I will leave those in the description
box below but they're a great pairing
for this cake and they're also a great
way to use up in your leftovers with all
of your cake layers cooked cool do
carved it's time to start stacking so a
little bit of that purple frosting
straight down on the cake board see if
it something for your bottom layer to
stick to and then down goes the cake
now I'm gonna syrup my cake if you're
gonna serve this the same day or the
morning after your making it there's no
need to syrup but the syrup will just
help it retain its moisture and stop it
from drying out now using my offset
spatula I'm just applying a thin coat of
that purple frosting the difference
between this rainbow layer cake and
other envelope cakes is a lot of them
break up the different colors in the
rainbow with white frosting but I've
opted to take that rainbow coloring all
the way through because they've got a
color that frosting to go around the
outside edges anyway on goes your next
layer which for me is going to be green
and
another coat of syrup before applying
another just a thin coat of that
buttercream frosting I will mention with
these cakes it is best if you can get
all of your layers about the same height
because it gives in that really uniform
look when you cut into them we're only
going to syrup that top layer we're not
going to put any frosting on and then
I'm gonna take my purple just on the tip
of my offset spatula because I really
only want purple along the bottom inch
or so of that cake and I'm just going
around the outside taking your green now
you want to kind of do it just in a line
above that purple so you can see what
we're doing then we're doing some orange
Red's gonna go on top now these side
colors don't have to be perfect they're
really just to give you a bit of a crumb
coat or a bit of a base coat but we
don't want them to be all the same color
because we want them to look rainbow
when the cakes cut into so now I'm just
using my offset spatula I'm gonna scrape
back the sides and don't worry if your
colors blend into each other a little
bit but you want to try and get the size
as flat as you can and then it spend a
little bit of time just trying to give
yourself a relatively sharp edge on the
top pop that cake off into the freezer
for about 20 minutes and let that first
coat of buttercream frosting completely
set so that you've got a really nice
firm base to start working on and then
you want to fill that disposable piping
bag with your first color which for me
is going to be purple paired up with
that lower number 15 open round tip
sorry I'm gonna tilt the cake a little
bit and you can see here what I'm doing
is I'm squeezing out just a small blob
of icing and then I'm actually using the
Ridge of the tip to flatten that
frosting off which gives us this really
nice special effect make sure that with
each of your colors you're starting at
the same point and finishing at the same
point on the back because you can either
smiley uneven edge with those petals
start and finish so moving on to the
green and you'll see I'm starting
exactly where I started with the purple
and I'm just over laying a blob and then
smoothing it down going onto the yellow
now once again starting at that joint at
the back and then moving on to the
orange you do want to be careful here
that you've got enough space for all
five of your colors going up the cake so
my red is finishing really really nice
and flush with the top you've got a
little bit of leeway
now blue we didn't do a blue cake layer
because I want this to look like the sky
and the clouds for our My Little Pony
cake so instead of going around the edge
we're going around the top and you'll
see that I'm actually going kind of in
on an angle as I'm squeezing and
flattening those little blobs and making
almost like a petal flower effect on the
top of the cake still coming in and our
little layers but there's going to be
quite a bit more blue frosting than any
of your other colors when you get to the
center you just want to squeeze in three
or four little petals to kind of finish
it off like the little center bud of a
flower in there that's your basic
rainbow layer cake now that turn this
into a My Little Pony rainbow layer cake
you just want to take your two skewers
and your printable rainbow template with
a little bit of sticky tape sticky tape
those two skewers on and you've got your
little support structure for your
rainbow tilt them in a little bit just
so that they fit nicely into the cake
and then you just want to position them
into the cake but make sure the base of
that rainbow is not actually touching
the frosting or else the frosting is
going to get absorbed up into it and
it's actually going to start to discolor
your rainbow put a little bit of
cornflour down now and you want to roll
out some of that white fondant I cut out
a couple of kind of haphazard rectangle
shapes no exact shape or size here I'm
gonna take a little bit more of that
syrup but you can also use just plain
water here and just give them a nice
coating and then I'm gonna put in my
little candy balls you could also use
little balls of fondant here but no one
wants to eat that big chunk of fondant
and I personally would love to have
sugar-coated Jeffers or sugar-coated
whoppers fold that over so that you're
trapping those candy balls inside and
that's going to give you out the puffy
shape of the cloud and you can see I'm
using my fingers to really make sure
that I'm neat nning down the edges and
joining them together that's syrup or
that water is gonna act like a glue use
your knife and trim around the edges you
don't have to get too close here because
then you can just use your fingers to
kind of like push in the edges making a
little cloud shape you want to bear in
mind you what these two clouds to be the
opposite of each other so one comes out
one side of the rainbow and the other
one goes out the other side of the
rainbow repeat that process for your
second cloud positioning those little
balls inside and on goes your second
cloud underneath your rainbow now it's
as simple as taking your two little my
little pony figurines and positioning
them this is a gorgeous rainbow cake
without the my little pony but with the
My Little Pony it's perfect with so many
my little pony fans so I'm gonna put
Rainbow Dash straight
on top of the cake just into that
buttercream frosting for rarity I'm
gonna give her a little bit of frosting
on each of her hooves just to stick her
in place and I'm gonna position head
down on the cake board that completes
your My Little Pony rainbow layer cake
as I said you can make it with the
ponies you can make it without make sure
that you check out my youtube channel my
cupcake addiction for those gorgeous My
Little Pony unicorn poop cupcakes which
I will link to in the description box
below and as always thanks very much for
tuning in to my critique addiction
